repnme.cdata!: Albania - Secondary and Local Roads Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Secondary and Local
            Roads Project for Albania were as follows: outcomes were
            highly satisfactory, risk to development outcome was
            moderate, Bank performance was satisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            to develop and implement a program, strong political support
            and commitment from all levels of government is paramount.
            For a programmatic approach of this type to be successful,
            particularly if it is to be attractive to other donors,
            there must be a strong strategy and action plan. Having a
            competent implementing agency able to effectively coordinate
            between multiple project stakeholders was instrumental in
            successfully managing the Secondary and Local Roads
            Improvement Program (SLRIP). Albanian Development Fund (ADF)
            did not have substantial experience in road construction and
            it was critical that they were supported by an international
            consultant with relevant experience with international
            financial institutions and road supervision. Bank teams to
            consider a reimbursable supervision arrangement financed by
            co-financiers who may request the Bank to take a lead in
            supervising the whole project. Wherever possible, and if
            cost permits, include all structures in the project and
            program. The inclusion of the environmental management plans
            (EMP) in the contract documentation helped to strengthened compliance.

repnme.cdata!:
Albania - Secondary and Local Roads Project
            : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Secondary and Local
            Roads Project is to improve access to essential services and
            economic markets, via the provision of all weather roads,
            for the resident population in the hinterland of the project
            roads. Following the Government of Albania (GoA) formal
            request of May 16, 2012, this paper is for a level two of
            the Albania Secondary and Local Roads Project (SLRP)
            restructuring to accommodate the following changes: (i)
            reallocation of credit proceeds (unused funds) to finance an
            additional priority section of the Albania secondary and
            local road network, and (ii) a 6 month extension of the
            closing date until June 30, 2013.

display_title.display_title:
Albania - Secondary and Local
            Roads Project : restructuring : Main report

16236483.majtheme: Rural development,Financial and private sector development,Public sector governance

repnme.cdata!:
Albania - Secondary and Local Roads Project
            : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Secondary and Local Roads Project is to improve access to
            essential services and economic markets, via the provision
            of all weather roads, for the resident population in the
            hinterland of the project roads. The requested reallocation
            is required to pay for an extension to the scope of the
            contract for consultant supervision, in terms of the number
            of road sections being reconstructed, within the program of
            reconstruction of secondary and local roads. This has been
            necessitated by the success of the project in leveraging in
            finance from other donors, and the corresponding increase in
            the number of construction contracts under implementation at
            any one time. The funds are available for reallocation as
            the work of the consultants procured with the project
            preparation advance was delayed, with some of the work
            taking place after effectiveness of the project.

display_title.display_title:
Albania - Secondary and Local
            Roads Project : restructuring (Vol. 2) : Data sheet
